summary: This is an FBI Task Force Officer's affidavit in support of an application for a search warrant to search 62 electronic devices seized from Jeffrey Epstein and his properties. The affidavit details the seizure of devices from Epstein's person, his New York residence, and his Virgin Islands residence, and establishes probable cause to search them for evidence of sex trafficking, enticement, transportation of minors, and conspiracy, involving Epstein and his associates, including Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure of the investigation, indicted for sex trafficking conspiracy and sex trafficking of minors. His electronic devices were seized upon arrest and from his residences. He died in custody in August 2019.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Identified as a potential co-conspirator who helped facilitate and participate in Epstein's abuse of minors, including transportation and enticement. Her communications were found on seized devices.

persons.name: Kelly Maguire
persons.context: Seized Subject Device-3 (two black hard drives) from a blue suitcase on July 11, 2019, during the search of Epstein's New York residence.

persons.name: Barbara Moses
persons.context: Signed the indictment arrest warrant for Epstein on July 2, 2019, and multiple search warrants for the New York residence and seized discs on July 6, 7, and 7, 2019.

persons.name: Henry B. Pitman
persons.context: Signed the Fourth Search Warrant on July 11, 2019, authorizing another search of the New York residence and seizure of electronic devices.

persons.name: Kevin Nathaniel Fox
persons.context: Signed the Fifth Search Warrant on July 14, 2019, authorizing the search of devices seized from Epstein's person and the blue suitcase.

persons.name: Ruth Miller
persons.context: Signed the Sixth Search Warrant on August 11, 2019, authorizing the search of the Virgin Islands Residence (Little Saint James).

persons.name: James L. Cott
persons.context: Signed the Seventh Search Warrant on September 12, 2019, authorizing the search of devices seized from the Virgin Islands Residence.

persons.name: Gabriel W. Gorenstein
persons.context: Signed the main search warrant application (this document) on June 26, 2020.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Listed as the United States Attorney on the sealed indictment against Jeffrey Epstein, which is attached as Exhibit A.

connections.description: Maxwell is identified as a co-conspirator who helped facilitate Epstein's abuse of minors, including transportation, enticement, and participation in sexualized massages.

Employee-2 is identified in the indictment as an employee who facilitated Epstein's abuse by scheduling victims' encounters. The affidavit notes Employee-2 is a Target Subject of the ongoing investigation.
Employee-3 is identified in the indictment as an employee who scheduled victims' encounters. Flight logs show Employee-3 traveled to the U.S. Virgin Islands multiple times.

In a 2004 email, Individual-4 asked Maxwell for details on payments for identifying 'beautiful, talented young women' to 'train/work with' Epstein, which the affiant interprets as recruitment for sex acts.
In 2002 emails, Individual-5 asked Maxwell about finding 'new inappropriate friends' and arranging for 'girls' on a trip, which the affiant interprets as arranging for young females for sex acts.

events.title: Arrest of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested by the FBI at Teterboro Airport in New Jersey upon arrival from France. Two electronic devices (iPad and iPhone) were seized from his person.

events.title: Searches of New York Residence
events.description: Multiple searches were executed at 9 East 71st Street, New York, NY, resulting in the seizure of compact discs, photographs, and 33 electronic devices. A 'massage room' with sex toys and nude photographs was discovered.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York and pronounced dead.

events.title: Search of Little Saint James
events.description: A search of Epstein's private island in the U.S. Virgin Islands (Little Saint James) resulted in the seizure of 27 electronic devices.

events.title: Indictment of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: A grand jury in the Southern District of New York returned an indictment charging Jeffrey Epstein with sex trafficking conspiracy and sex trafficking of minors.

events.title: Abuse of Minor Victim-1
events.description: Epstein and Maxwell began sexually abusing Minor Victim-1 starting when she was approximately 14 years old, including in New York and Florida. Maxwell was present and involved in group sexualized massages.

events.title: $250,000 Wire Transfer
events.description: Epstein wired $250,000 from a trust account to an individual (redacted, likely Employee-2) days after the Miami Herald published articles about his misconduct, which the government suggests was an attempt to influence a potential witness.

events.title: Epstein Amends Will
events.description: Epstein amended his will to bequeath $10,000,000 to Ghislaine Maxwell and forgive loans to another associate, changing bequests from a February 2019 version.

locations: 9 East 71st Street, New York, NY (Epstein's New York Residence)
Little Saint James, U.S. Virgin Islands (Epstein's private island)
Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), New York, NY
Palm Beach, Florida (location of another Epstein residence mentioned in the attached indictment)
keyFacts: The affidavit seeks to expand the search of 62 seized electronic devices to include evidence of additional crimes (enticement and transportation of minors) and to specifically target communications and data related to Ghislaine Maxwell and other co-conspirators.

Searches of Epstein's New York residence revealed a 'massage room' with sex toys, nude photographs of young girls, and thousands of nude/partially nude photographs of girls on compact discs, some labeled with names, 'LSJ' (Little Saint James), and 'Zorro' (Epstein's New Mexico ranch).

The investigation indicates Epstein's sexual abuse of minors started earlier than previously charged (as early as 1994) and that Ghislaine Maxwell participated in facilitating and engaging in the abuse, including transporting and enticing at least one minor victim.
Evidence suggests attempts to conceal or remove evidence after initial searches; an employee was instructed to remove contents from a safe after the first search, which were later recovered.
Emails extracted from seized devices show Ghislaine Maxwell communicating with other individuals about recruiting young women for Epstein and arranging for 'girls' for another individual's trips.
